movie_title: Tech that refuses to die ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Technology is always changing! Or is it...? Why is some old technology still used? For audio and tra

vocabulary.definition: no longer in use, having been replaced by something newer or better
vocabulary.example: VHS tapes have become obsolete with the rise of streaming services.

vocabulary.definition: machinery that uses metal springs and wheels which move when wound up with a key
vocabulary.example: The antique clock on the mantelpiece is a beautiful piece of clockwork technology.

vocabulary.definition: using exactly the same words that were originally spoken
vocabulary.example: The lawyer transcribed the witness's statement verbatim.

vocabulary.definition: to make something conform to a standard or norm
vocabulary.example: It would be beneficial to standardise measurements across all industries.

vocabulary.definition: unwelcoming or harsh environments that are difficult to live in
vocabulary.example: The Arctic region is known for its inhospitable conditions.

vocabulary.definition: gaining popularity or attention on social media or the internet
vocabulary.example: The new app is trending on Twitter due to its innovative features.
